name: The Midnight
bio: The Midnight is an American synthwave band composed of Atlanta-based singer-songwriter Tyler Lyle and Los Angeles-based Danish-born producer Tim McEwan. They have released multiple studio albums and have become one of the most prominent acts in the synthwave genre, known for their nostalgic 80s-inspired sound and evocative storytelling.
description: Pioneers of the modern synthwave movement

name: GUNSHIP
bio: GUNSHIP is a British synthwave band formed in 2014. The band consists of Dan Haigh, Alex Westaway, and Alex Gingell. Known for their cinematic approach to synthwave, incorporating video game and movie samples into their music, GUNSHIP has become a defining act in the darksynth subgenre.

name: Perturbator
bio: Perturbator is the pseudonym of James Kent, a French synthwave musician from Paris. Known for creating dark, aggressive synthwave music with horror and cyberpunk influences, Perturbator has been instrumental in defining the darksynth subgenre and has collaborated with video game developers and horror film directors.
description: Dark synthwave with horror and cyberpunk aesthetics

name: FM-84
bio: FM-84 is the synthwave project of Scottish producer Col Bennett. Taking inspiration from 80s pop culture, movies, and music, FM-84 creates emotional and nostalgic synthwave that perfectly captures the essence of the decade. The project has gained massive popularity for its authentic 80s sound and cinematic music videos.

name: Carpenter Brut
bio: Carpenter Brut is the stage name of Franck Hueso, a French darksynth artist from Poitiers. Known for blending synthwave with horror movie aesthetics and metal influences, Carpenter Brut creates intense, theatrical music that has been featured in video games and horror films. The project is known for its dramatic live performances and distinctive visual style.

name: Power Trip
bio: Power Trip is an outrun synthwave project that captures the essence of 80s arcade culture and neon-soaked nightlife. Known for high-energy tracks perfect for late-night drives and gaming sessions, Power Trip combines classic synthwave elements with modern production techniques to create an authentic retro-futuristic sound.
description: High-energy outrun with arcade game influences

name: Timecop1983
bio: Timecop1983 is the synthwave project of Jordy Leenaerts from the Netherlands. Creating dreamy, nostalgic synthwave with a focus on melody and atmosphere, Timecop1983 has become synonymous with the chillwave side of synthwave. His music often features romantic themes and captures the emotional essence of 80s pop culture.
description: Dreamy synthwave with romantic and nostalgic themes

name: Nina
bio: Nina is a French synthwave vocalist and producer who brings a unique feminine perspective to the synthwave genre. With her ethereal vocals and atmospheric production, Nina creates emotional synthwave that combines elements of dream pop and new wave. Her music often explores themes of love, loss, and nostalgia with a distinctly 80s aesthetic.
description: Ethereal synthwave with dream pop influences

name: Lata Mangeshkar
bio: Lata Mangeshkar was an Indian playback singer and occasional music composer. She was widely considered one of the greatest and most influential singers in India. Her career spanned over seven decades, during which she recorded songs in over 36 Indian languages. Known as the 'Nightingale of India', she received numerous awards including the Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian honor.
description: The Nightingale of India - legendary playback singer

name: Alka Yagnik
bio: Alka Yagnik is an Indian playback singer who works predominantly in Hindi cinema. She has been described in the media as one of the most prominent playback singers in Bollywood. She has received several accolades, including two National Film Awards and seven Filmfare Awards. She holds the Guinness World Record for being the most streamed Indian artist on YouTube.
description: Most streamed Indian artist with melodious voice

name: Udit Narayan
bio: Udit Narayan is an Indian playback singer whose songs have been featured mainly in Hindi films. He has sung in 34 languages for films made in various Indian states. He has won four National Film Awards and five Filmfare Awards. He was awarded the Padma Shri in 2009 and Padma Bhushan in 2016 by the Government of India for his contribution to the arts.
description: Versatile playback singer across multiple Indian languages
